channel.title: Projects on Grace Liu
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on Grace Liu

item.title: Project 3: Predicting 2020 U.S. Federal Presidential Election
item.description: Constructed a logistic regression with random intercepts model to analyze the log odds of voting for Trump as a linear combination of predictors, estimating both fixed and random effects from individual and group-leveled data Performed post-stratification to adjust the weights of the survey sample based on Census data, ensuring that nonresponse and underrepresented groups are accounted for Link to GitHub Repository

item.title: Project 2: Testing Causality between Smoking and Sleep Trouble
item.description: Applied propensity score matching to isolate the effects of smoking on sleep trouble by creating matches between a basis non-smoking group and a comparison smoking group with similar pretreatment characteristics, preserving 94% of original data for causality analysis Predicted the probability of experiencing sleep trouble using logistic regression in R, ensuring that the results are representative by checking model diagnostics and addressing model inferences and limitations

item.title: Project 1: Modelling Canadaâ€™s Social Distancing during COVID-19
item.description: Created a new metric “Social Distancing Score” from Google’s community data by standardizing 6 mobility factors Prepared regression data using cross validation, residual&QQ plots, influential observations and feature selection to construct MLR measuring the significance of factors that influence social distancing behaviour Eliminated the problem of multicollinearity and improved inference by 20% by computing the permutation feature importance after fitting a random forests classifier
